reporting-org.narrative: Norad - Norwegian Agency for Development Cooperation

description.narrative: Sudan Transition and Recovery Support (STARS) is a Multi-Donor Trust Fund (MDTF) established by the World Bank at the request of the Government of Sudan. Norwegian support has a preference for Family Support Program (FSP). The main objective of FSP is to deliver cash transfer support to selected Sudanese households affected by expected economic reforms and other short-term shocks . Another important component is to strengthen institutional capacities in Sudan s Ministry of Finance and Economic Planning, including relevant government agencies by establishing efficient delivery systems and a national social protection scheme. STARS has four thematic areas: (1) social protection; (2) economic revival and better governance; (3) peacebuilding, resilience and basic services; and (4) crisis response. WB's efforts to support the FSP falls under area (1) social protection, although STARS indirectly also contributes to area (2) Economic Revival and Better Governance. Any Norwegian funding for STARS would be allocated to thematic area 1. Implementing partners of FSP are Ministries of Finance and Economic Planning, Labor and Social Development, and Interior, along with other relevant agencies, and will be executed by the Digital Economy Agency, Zain and MTN mobile providers, and World Food Program.

title.narrative: SDN-20/0004 - Sudan Transition and Recovery Support (STARS)
